links.title: Snapshot isolation - Wikipedia
links.description: In databases, and transaction processing (transaction management), snapshot isolation is a guarantee that all reads made in a transaction will see a consistent snapshot of the database (in practice it reads the last committed values that existed at the time it started), and the transaction itself will successfully commit only if no updates it has made conflict with any concurrent updates made since that snapshot.

links.title: Rope (data structure) - Wikipedia
links.description: In computer programming, a rope, or cord, is a data structure composed of smaller strings that is used to efficiently store and manipulate a very long string. For example, a text editing program may use a rope to represent the text being edited, so that operations such as insertion, deletion, and random access can be done efficiently.[1]

links.title:
Robert Sweeney on LinkedIn: "I turned down Daniel Buchmueller for a job at Netflix. After a 60 minute interview I was on the fence, so I concluded that he "wasn't senior enough." He went to Amazon instead where he co-founded Amazon Prime Air (their drone delivery service) and was #2 on Fast Company's "Most Creative People" list.

At some point, we programmers are going to have to admit that we really can't judge another programmers technical abilities in a 60 min interview. We end up hiring programmers that are good at interviewing, but not necessarily good at doing the job. And we miss out on engineers like Daniel.

#hiring #softwareengineer #programmers #interviews"
links.description: April 29, 2019: Robert Sweeney posted on LinkedIn
links.original_title: We can't judge another programmer's abilities in a 60 min interview

links.title: Code Staging in GNU Guix
links.description: GNU Guix is a “functional” package manager that builds upon earlier work on Nix.  Guix implements high-level abstractions such as packages and operating system services as domain-specic languages (DSLs) embedded in Scheme.  It also implements build actions and operating system orchestration in Scheme.  This leads to a multi-tier programming environment where embedded code snippets are staged for eventual execution. links.title: Right to Internet access - Wikipedia
